subdisciplines.name: Digital Media Studies
subdisciplines.description: The study of digital media and their impact on society, culture, and communication.

subdisciplines.name: Film Studies
subdisciplines.description: The academic study of films as a form of art, entertainment, and communication.

subdisciplines.name: Journalism Studies
subdisciplines.description: The study of the production, distribution, and reception of news and other forms of media content.

subdisciplines.name: Media Psychology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the psychological processes underlying media and communication, including media effects and audience behavior.

subdisciplines.name: Media Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of how media shape and are shaped by culture, society, politics, and economics.

subdisciplines.name: Audience Studies
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people receive, consume, and interpret media messages.

subdisciplines.name: Media Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of how economic principles and concepts apply to media industries and markets.

subdisciplines.name: Media History
subdisciplines.description: The study of historical developments, innovations, and transformations within the media industry.

subdisciplines.name: Media Literacy
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people create, interpret, and evaluate media messages.

subdisciplines.name: Media Policy
subdisciplines.description: The study of laws, regulations, and policies that shape media ownership, control, and content.

subdisciplines.name: Media Production
subdisciplines.description: The study of how media messages are created, produced, and distributed.

subdisciplines.name: Media Psychology
subdisciplines.description: The study of how media messages affect people's attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors.

subdisciplines.name: Media Sociology
subdisciplines.description: The study of how media messages reflect and reinforce social structures, norms, and values.
